poem:
Boundless Freedom  

In the land of endless sun,  
shadows stretch across  
concrete borders, where a name  
rides the fickle wind.  

Chains invisible cling,  
whispering the silence  
of unseen bars. Birds gather,  
tales enshrined within wings,  

stalled mid-flight. The air holds  
its breath, thick with longing,  
as liberty waits, forgotten  
on the runway of hope.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Abd el-Fattah was pardoned after more than 10 years in jail but his status, including his right to travel back and forth between Britain and Egypt, was left unclear and subject to discussion between". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
